title: Sarfaraz Ahmed:Sacked Pakistan Captain Sarfaraz’s Wife Defends Him Amid Retirement Jibes, Asks ‘Has MS Dhoni Retired?’
text:
Pakistan wicketkeeper Sarfaraz Ahmed was sacked as Pakistan captain last week after a slew of below-par performances by the side under his leadership.

After being given the boot, Pakistan Cricket Board announced that Babar Azam and Azhar Ali will share the captaincy duties in the upcoming T20I and Tests series against Australia, respectively.

Agencies

The wicketkeeper was also not named in the squad for the upcoming series.

Having being ignored completely from the squad, the rumours have been rife that Sarfaraz Ahmed might call time on his career.

But Ahmed’s wife has reportedly brushed the rumours aside and has backed his husband to make a comeback. Speaking in an interview to Times Now, Sarfaraz’s wife Khusbhat Sarfaraz said: “Why should he retire now? He is only 32. How old is Dhoni? Has he retired at his current age? My husband will make a strong come back. He is a fighter and will come back.”

Sarfaraz has paid the price for team's dismal showing over the last few months, having also failed to make the semifinals at the World Cup.

It might seem a bit harsh considering he led them to a Champions Trophy win in 2017, and also to the top of T20 rankings.

But PCB's patience ran its course as they took the big decision and wielded the axe.
